isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9800 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - KEY SWITCH AND CYLINDER

svcprocinfo.para: The ignition key switch and door locks are coded differently so that two separate keys operate the ignition switch and door locks. The code number is stamped on the key switch body just back of the cap nut. The code number does not appear on the door lock assembly.
To locate the code number on the key switch, remove the key switch mounting cap nut and remove key switch from instrument panel.
At customer request, the key switch and door locks can be coded the same so that one key operates both key switch and door lock cylinders.

step1.para: The ignition key switch ( Item 1, Figure 31) is located to the right of the driver below the switches in the wing panel ( Item 2, Figure 31). Remove key switch as follows.
Unscrew mounting cap nut ( Item 3, Figure 31) and remove it from the key switch ( Item 1, Figure 31).
Reach up behind the dash panel ( Item 1, Figure 32) and pull the key switch ( Item 2, Figure 32) down and out of the dash panel.

figure.caption: Figure 32. Pull Key Switch Down and Out of Dash Panel

step1.para: Disconnect the electrical connector ( Item 1, Figure 33) from the back of the key switch ( Item 2, Figure 33) and remove from the vehicle.

Insert the ignition key ( Item 1, Figure 34) into the key switch ( Item 2, Figure 34) and rotate counterclockwise to accessory position, so that the key is lined-up with the release hole ( Item 3, Figure 34) in the key switch body.

figure.caption: Figure 34. Insert Ignition into Key Switch

step1.para: Insert a 1/16 inch (1.6 mm) diameter rod (paper clip) ( Item 1, Figure 35) into the release hole ( Item 3, Figure 34) in the key switch body of the key switch ( Item 2, Figure 35) and depress switch cylinder retainer. Pull the complete switch cylinder ( Item 1, Figure 36) from the key switch body ( Item 2, Figure 36).

figure.caption: Figure 35. Insert Clip or Rod into Release Hole
Figure 36. Pull Switch Cylinder From Key Switch Body

note.para: If vehicle keys are lost, drill out the switch cylinder. Use a 5/16 inch (8 mm) drill bit to drill 1/2 to 3/4 inch (12.7 to 19 mm) deep. This will permit the tumblers to drop out and free the switch cylinder.

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: If the original key is desired when replacing the key switch cylinder, code the new key switch cylinder accordingly. Use the following procedure.

step1.para: Insert original key in new key switch cylinder (before insertion into switch body) ( Figure 37). File off the tumblers that protrude from the cylinder. Make certain that no burrs are left on the tumblers and that all filings are blown out with compressed air.

figure.caption: Figure 37. Insert Original Key in New Key Switch Cylinder

step1.para: To re-install the same switch cylinder or to install a new switch cylinder ( Item 1, Figure 36), apply a small quantity of powdered graphite to the tumblers, then insert the ignition key ( Item 3, Figure 36) into the switch cylinder. Rotate counterclockwise to accessory position and insert switch cylinder back into key switch body ( Item 2, Figure 36). Rotate the key to the off position and remove the key.
Position the key switch ( Item 2, Figure 33) at the dash panel and connect the electrical connector ( Item 1, Figure 33) to the back of the key switch.
Position the key switch ( Item 2, Figure 32) up behind the dash panel ( Item 1, Figure 32) and insert it into the dash panel.

With the key switch ( Item 1, Figure 31) pushed through the dash panel ( Item 2, Figure 31) and positioned properly, install the mounting cap nut ( Item 3, Figure 31) securing it to the dash panel. Tighten snugly.
